entry.title: Return of the OPPO Find 5
entry.content:
Yesterday, I received a brand new OPPO Find 5. My previous one died after six months of use when it refused to charge. Luckily, the warranty on it lasts for two years. I mailed the broken phone back, and was sent a replacement.

I was of course thrilled when the DHL delivery person arrived. After answering the buzzer, I met with him at the front door of my apartment building. He had another package with him, and said that its recipient sounded much more excited than I did. The package was a PS4.

entry.title: KFC
entry.content: I have been eating at KFC lately. I am not sure why, but I have been having massive fried chicken cravings. At KFC, I usually get their Zinger sandwich. It is made up of one fried chicken breast, one piece of lettuce, spicy mayonnaise sauce, and two buns. That is it. It is pretty expensive too, costing $8.39 when gotten with fries and a drink. I love it, but I have got to stop eating it.

entry.title: Geoff Jarman
entry.content: Every once in a while, I'd get a thin little notepad in my mailbox. Written at the top of these notepads will be, in big capital letters, the name "Geoff Jarman". Apparently, he is a realtor for Sutton West Coast Realty. He must be a very happy employee, because printed between his first and last name is a picture of him with an enormous grin on his face. I am glad that he is choosing to share that happiness with me by sporadically giving me free notepads. Geoff Jarman, I thank you. You are a God amongst men.
